description:
[Android] Disable prerendering for low end devices.

Add a check for low end devices before enabling prerendering.

BUG=251280

Committed: https://src.chromium.org/viewvc/chrome?view=rev&revision=208499

messages.text:
Hey Chris,

Could you take a look at this CL?

Thanks,
Aurimas
Have you looked at re-enabling the other code branch I pointed out (to see if a new process could be created) rather than use this fixed logic?

LGTM

https://codereview.chromium.org/17520007/diff/1/chrome/browser/prerender/prerender_manager.cc
File chrome/browser/prerender/prerender_manager.cc (right):

https://codereview.chromium.org/17520007/diff/1/chrome/browser/prerender/prerender_manager.cc#newcode230
chrome/browser/prerender/prerender_manager.cc:230: : enabled_(profile && profile->GetPrefs() &&
This is getting complex enough that it should probably move into a helper function.

LGTM

https://codereview.chromium.org/17520007/diff/1/chrome/browser/prerender/prerender_manager.cc
File chrome/browser/prerender/prerender_manager.cc (right):

https://codereview.chromium.org/17520007/diff/1/chrome/browser/prerender/prerender_manager.cc#newcode230
chrome/browser/prerender/prerender_manager.cc:230: : enabled_(profile && profile->GetPrefs() &&
This is getting complex enough that it should probably move into a helper function.
Another option is to create a new PrerenderCondition here.

On 2013/06/24 19:01:26, cbentzel wrote:
> Another option is to create a new PrerenderCondition here.

The reason I was thinking this was because the duplication of logic in the constructor as well as set_enabled, which makes me worry that this approach is error prone. However, PrerenderCondition is probably overkill.

I think the simplest thing is to move this into PrerenderManagerFactory::BuildServiceInstanceFor. The code should be able to handle NULL PrerenderManager's for a particular profile.

On 2013/06/24 23:36:26, cbentzel wrote:
> On 2013/06/24 19:01:26, cbentzel wrote:
> > Another option is to create a new PrerenderCondition here.
> 
> The reason I was thinking this was because the duplication of logic in the
> constructor as well as set_enabled, which makes me worry that this approach is
> error prone. However, PrerenderCondition is probably overkill.
> 
> I think the simplest thing is to move this into
> PrerenderManagerFactory::BuildServiceInstanceFor. The code should be able to
> handle NULL PrerenderManager's for a particular profile.

Moved the check to PrendererManagerFactory. How does this look?

On 2013/06/25 00:30:43, aurimas wrote:
> On 2013/06/24 23:36:26, cbentzel wrote:
> > On 2013/06/24 19:01:26, cbentzel wrote:
> > > Another option is to create a new PrerenderCondition here.
> > 
> > The reason I was thinking this was because the duplication of logic in the
> > constructor as well as set_enabled, which makes me worry that this approach is
> > error prone. However, PrerenderCondition is probably overkill.
> > 
> > I think the simplest thing is to move this into
> > PrerenderManagerFactory::BuildServiceInstanceFor. The code should be able to
> > handle NULL PrerenderManager's for a particular profile.
> 
> Moved the check to PrendererManagerFactory. How does this look?

LGTM

Thanks!

CQ is trying da patch. Follow status at
https://chromium-status.appspot.com/cq/aurimas@chromium.org/17520007/14001

subject: [Android] Disable prerendering for low end devices.
